alert.note: Alert for Sebastian (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 10 at 7:34AM CDT until June 10 at 8:45AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 AM CDT THIS MORNING FOR SEBASTIAN, SOUTHERN CHEROKEE, NORTHEASTERN MUSKOGEE, SEQUOYAH, NORTHEASTERN HASKELL AND NORTHEASTERN LE FLORE COUNTIES... At 734 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Fort Smith... Muskogee... Sallisaw... Poteau... Greenwood... Barling... Fort Gibson... Pocola... Muldrow... Roland... Spiro... Arkoma... Vian... Panama... Gore... Hackett... Hartford... Huntington... Webbers Falls... Bonanza... 2 to 5 inches of rain have fallen with an additional inch or so expected before the heavy rain ends. Numerous roads have been closed in the city of Fort Smith. Numerous roads have been reported as flooded in Greenwood, Sequoyah County and in the Muskogee area. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
